summary: Marketing website for Falconrock Consulting, an IT consulting company focused on virtualization and on‑prem infrastructure/IA for government contracts, with plans to publish under the falconrock.app domain.
architectural_notes: Deployment/publishing domain/slug must be 5–50 characters and include only letters, numbers, and hyphens (no spaces/parentheses/plus signs).
known_issues: Deployment fails with error: generated domain/slug "falconrock-consulting-(virtualization-+-on‑prem-ia" contains invalid characters and violates length/charset constraints (must be 5–50 chars; only letters/numbers/hyphens).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Falconrock logo mark, modern minimalist, strong geometric shape, no text, transparent background (falconrock-logo.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Create a responsive marketing website for an IT consulting company specializing in virtualization and on‑prem infrastructure / IA work for government contracts.
Implement core site pages/sections with clear navigation: Home (hero + value proposition), Services, Capabilities (government contracting/IA-focused), About, and Contact.
Add a Contact form that collects name, organization, email, and message, validates inputs, and submits to the backend; show success and error states.
Add an admin-only UI view that lets a signed-in admin review submitted contact inquiries (basic list + detail view).

Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme appropriate for a government-facing IT consultancy (color palette, typography, spacing, and component styling) and enforce it consistently across all pages/sections (avoid blue/purple as the dominant theme).
Add generated static image assets (logo + hero visual) to the frontend and render them in the layout (e.g., navbar/hero) from the static assets directory.

Replace all user-facing instances of the placeholder company name (e.g., "SecureInfra Solutions") with "Falconrock Consulting" across the marketing site and admin UI where applicable (header, footer, section headings, alt text, and any other displayed labels).

Update the site’s domain-facing copy and metadata to align with the intended domain "falconrock.app" (e.g., update the HTML document <title> and replace placeholder contact email domain text so it no longer uses "secureinfra.example").

Update the project’s deployment-facing name/slug source so it generates a valid domain label (5–50 characters; only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens) and does not include parentheses, plus signs, spaces, or non-ASCII hyphen characters.
Generate a new static Falconrock logo image asset and add it to the frontend static assets directory so it can be used in the header and Home page.
Remove the existing top-left header logo image and replace it with the newly generated Falconrock logo, keeping the header branding (company name/tagline) intact.

Make the company name “Falconrock Consulting” more prominent on the Home page by adjusting the hero content hierarchy to feature the company name strongly (and include the new logo in the Home hero area).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a clean, professional website for an IT consulting company specializing in virtualization and on‑prem infrastructure/IA for government contracts (services/capabilities showcase).
Implement backend support to store contact inquiries (timestamped) and expose query methods to list and read inquiries for an authenticated admin user using Internet Identity.

In project_state.json, change the value that is currently used as the project name ("Falconrock Consulting (virtualization + on‑prem IA for government contracts)") to a slug-safe value that meets the domain/slug constraints.
Make the company name “Falconrock Consulting” more prominent on the Home page (e.g., hero/header typography and placement).
Design/generate a new “Falconrock” logo, place it on the Home page, and remove/replace the existing top-left logo.

projectName: Falconrock Consulting (virtualization + on‑prem IA for government contracts)
